_comment: Improved JSON structure for better data organization and machine-readability.

history.summary: A World War I fighter squadron of the Luftstreitkräfte, credited with 57 aerial victories. Notably commanded by ace Rudolph Berthold, it was one of only three squadrons to be fully equipped with Fokker Dr.I triplanes while operating independently of a wing.

formation.context: Formed from a preceding ad hoc unit, Fokkerstaffel Falkenhausen, in the Armee-Abteilung A Sector.

notableEvents.event: Supported the 17th Armee during Germany's last great offensive.

commanders.name: Rudolph Berthold
commanders.note: One of Germany's leading aces (44 victories), awarded the Pour le Mérite, Military Order of Saint Henry, and Iron Cross.

notablePilots.name: Josef Veltjens
notablePilots.note: High-scoring ace with 35 victories, recipient of the Pour le Mérite and Royal House Order of Hohenzollern.

notablePilots.name: Joachim-Friedrich Huth
notablePilots.note: Claimed one victory; later served in the WWII Luftwaffe, retiring as a Generalleutnant.

markings.description: A black and white band running the length of the aircraft's fuselage.

source.comment: Original source path was an absolute path, changed to a relative one for portability.
